thread.title: Former Red Sox ace says 'ISIS' won Dem debate
thread.title_full: Former Red Sox ace says 'ISIS' won Dem debate | Washington Examiner

author: Gabby Morrongiello
title: Former Red Sox ace says 'ISIS' won Dem debate
text:
Former Red Sox pitcher Curt Schilling, who is no stranger to controversy, said halfway through Tuesday night's Democratic primary debate that "ISIS" was the real winner of the event.
The baseball announcer has been indefinitely suspended from ESPN since August, when he tweeted a meme comparing Muslims to Nazis. "The math is staggering when you get to true #'s," Schilling said at the time, in reference to the population of Muslim extremists.
Schilling added fuel to the fire Tuesday when Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump asked his followers who they thought was winning the Democratic debate.
Who is winning the debate so far (just last name)? #DemDebate — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 14, 2015 
More from the Washington Examiner Trump beats Clinton in debate-night Twitter race Trump's live tweeting the debate led him to receive more new followers than any of the Democratic hopefuls.
By Gabby Morrongiello • 10/14/15 1:02 PM Within seconds, Schilling responded: "ISIS."
@realDonaldTrump ISIS— Curt Schilling (@gehrig38) October 14, 2015 
Despite being one of the first to respond to the billionaire on Twitter, Schilling previously said he not would support Trump as a candidate following the businessman's remarks about Arizona Sen. John McCain's war hero status.
